newsitem.title: ITALY: Ambroveneto stays high as trading restarts.
newsitem.headline: Ambroveneto stays high as trading restarts.

text.p: Shares in Italian banking group Ambroveneto held at sharply higher levels in Monday afternoon trading after being temporarily suspended at the Milan bourse's 10 percent limit-up level earlier, dealers said.
The stock was last quoted up 9.96 percent at 7,375 lire at 1430 GMT. The shares have gained 16 percent last week and are around 90 percent higher from the start of the year.

Ambroveneto is planning a merger with Milan-based savings bank Cariplo and the market in many Italian banking shares has been buoyed higher by talk of takeovers and restructuring. Banca di Roma shares were up 8.18 percent at 1,454 lire.
